events.name: Designed for Innovation: Innovation Ecosystem
events.description:
Design Session: Singapore Innovation Ecosystem We will provide a hand-on session of discussing and designing initiatives for the Design Innovation Ecosystem in Singapore. In this session, we will use the Design Thinking Toolkit. For experienced Designers, it will be interesting as we are discussing and designing the Innovation Ecosystem. For individuals who are interested in Design Thinking you will get some hands-on experience. We hope to see you all on Tuesday, July 11th at 6 pm at NUS Enterprise. 


Designed for Innovation SeriesCompanies large and small are increasingly turning to innovation to sustain their competiveness. Many try to adopt innovation methods practiced by startups (customer development, MVPs, validated learning, intrapreneurship, etc.) while some even try to annex whole startups through incubation and accelerator programs. Unfortunately, the outcomes have been a mixed bag. Lean startup practices are hard to implement in large organizations, and feisty startups rarely thrive within rigid corporate frameworks.  This collaborative meetup series between NUS Enterprise and Design Innovation SG will explore if there is a better way for corporations to tap the entrepreneurship wave. We shall examine how Design Thinking strategies may be adapted to help companies better engage the startup ecosystem. Experienced innovators, designers, strategists and practitioners will be invited to share and discuss what did and did not work in their own innovation journeys. In the first seminar on 21st February at 6pm, we will explore how to bring &gt;&gt; Design Thinking into Organizations &lt;&lt;. Please only sign up, if you are coming as the spaces are limited and bring your business card with you.
events.location: The Franklin , 3 Science Park Drive #01-06/09 , Singapore

events.name: Preview Talk - StackUp
events.description:
GET STARTED IN TECH NOW
Do you want to be a developer or an engineer? Are you curious about the tech industry?Join us for our Preview Talk! We will be conducting a short brief on our course offerings and tracks available. Get to know more about our amazing community and the wonderful stuff that we do. Our staff will also be around to answer your queries.If you have been thinking about transitioning to a tech-related career, let us help you get started.
For more on StackUp's course offerings and tracks, click here.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: Automated Testing World - A view of SauceCon 2017 by Ruchika
events.description: Have you heard of SauceCon 2017? Cool. Did you get a chance to attend any talks? No! No worries our friend Ruchika Rawat from Carousell Singapore has kindly agreed to share her experience, best practices and visionary content from the leading minds in automated testing world, with us on 11th July evening.  Agenda: 6.30 to 7.00 PM - Snacks & Networking 7.00 to 8.00 PM - Talk 8.00 onwards     - Q&A
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: PyData Meetup - July 2017
events.description:
Agenda  • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 8:00pm Presentation: Deep Dive into Azure’s Machine Learning Framework - Using Machine Learning and Data Science Products to Solve Real-World Problems Ujjwal Kumar is a Senior Technical Evangelist in Microsoft Developer Experience Evangelism (DX) group based out of Singapore. He focusses on cloud computing - Microsoft Azure, Blockchain as a Serviceq, IoT, Machine Learning, Bot framework and cross platform mobile games, apps based solution architecture, design and development.  In the current role he works with business, students, startups, enterprises, partner organizations and assists them in adoption of latest platforms and technologies. He is also a founder of 'India Gamers Community', co-founder of 'IoT community', an avid technologist and a prominent speaker.Prior to current role, he worked as Partner Consultant and development platforms Worldwide Specialization Lead at Microsoft. He has around 14 years of industry experience and he has been with Microsoft for 10+ years. He has extensively worked on C++, C#, Microsoft Azure, Windows Internals, Robotics Studio, Game development and IoT. Updates Join us on Facebook and Twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors • O'REILLY MEDIA INC.  


• ENGINEERS.SG  


• NUMFOCUS
events.location: Microsoft Singapore Auditorium, Level 21, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: How VR 360 can give your business a competitive edge.
events.description:
How VR 360 can give your business a competitive edge.

Director Ellie Ngim will share her journey in VR 360 filmaking and how this new technology can be applied to business for a competitive edge. Ellie will delve into VR, AR and Mixed reality. She will also share her opinion on the future of VR.

Ellie Ngim was a nominated Directing Fellow in the prestigious Busan Asian Film Academy 2015, an educational program hosted by the Busan International Film Festival. Past mentors of the program include Wang Xiaoshuai, Béla Tarr, Jia Zhangke, Hou Hsiao Hsien and Anthony Chen. Ellie’s journey in Media started in 2010 and her work has been screened in more than 6 international film festivals. She is currently a Director in Bert Pictures and BeVRR, and has shot for clients locally and overseas. She has also recently completed her first Feature length movie, titled ‘Uplift’ after successfully launching the first 360 VR lifestyle series, ‘Dining Stars’ during the Asian TV Festival in Singapore.


Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/how-vr-360-can-give-your-business-a-competitive-edge-tickets-35859845764
events.location: Toa Payoh Public Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore 319191

events.name: VR: Research from Abroad
events.description: We have an exciting lineup of 4 speakers! This time round, our speakers all have experiences to share from abroad.  Sarah Tan from Against Gravity - Sarah will be speaking about Social VR, of which her company is making REC ROOM, currently the top game where many people come together to play games together! Avinav Trigunait from IDC - Avinav will present how different industries are using ARVR, opportunities and challenges and risks as well. Its not just about games! Ashima Thomas from Warrior9 - Ashima just returned from the Cannes Film Festival where they debuted the first episode of their VR scifi series The PhoenIX. They have lots to share about the world of cinematic, narrative and experimental VR content. Will we get to watch Episode 1 here too? Come down to find out more! Alvin Lim from CGangs VR - CGangsVR specializes in 360 content production, and live 360 streaming services. They have also an impressive array of custom built 3/7/9 360 camera rigs with real time preview solution. Familiar with the more mature industry and 360 video ecosystem in China, Alvin will share insights about how the local ecosystem can progress. We will also be showing some showcases from the Global VR Hackathon - Singapore that we organized! Find out more at http://vrhackathonsg.com/ And don't forget to check out our AsiaVR Company Directory, featuring a who's who of the 360 video, VR and AR scene in Singapore and beyond!
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group
